text: It does focus more on the CMS side but most of the content is applicable to both CMS and email

I'll have to take a closer look at that. I was really pleased that I could use extend template partials more than one level too! Makes it easier to create templates.

As soon as base templates are available in the D&D editor...

Actually what would be utterly amazing is to make modules portable so you can for example import a YAML or JSON file and HubSpot automatically creates groups/fields/attributes etc.

Well sir i have fun news for you. You actually can import fields and groups. Use the ftp and open a module, youll notice all of the data for the module that is not in the 3 panes is outputted as json files and you can modify them and create modules that way.
I think atleast right now HS doesnt have a developer oriented email certification simply because there is a ton of overlap between the CMS and how HS does emails.
I could see though now that theres a free version of their email marketing tool demand for such a certification will probably rise quite a bit
It would be nice to have the name of the selected image file so if you want to use the image elsewhere you know what itâ€™s called.
Coming from a variety of other CMS platforms... HubSpot really really really needs a proper staging system.  Rolling out a new design is just a nightmare.
Use content staging works pretty great. Doesn't handle blogs but it's perfect for site redesigns
yes also inside the email templates custom modules area
